title: Highest Consumer Price Index
description: In 2022, Sudan recorded a Consumer Price Index of 38,796.56, indicating a significant rise in the cost of goods and services compared to the base year 2010.

title: Largest GDP Deflator
description: Sudan's GDP deflator reached 462,510.92 in 2023, reflecting substantial inflationary pressures within the economy.

title: Highest Gross National Expenditure Deflator
description: In 2023, Sudan's gross national expenditure deflator was 436,517.06, highlighting the inflationary impact on national spending.

title: High Tariff Rate on Manufactured Products
description: Sudan imposed a tariff rate of 26.8% on manufactured products in 2021, one of the highest rates globally, affecting trade competitiveness.

title: Significant Broad Money to Total Reserves Ratio
description: In 2017, Sudan's broad money to total reserves ratio was 54.43, indicating a high level of money supply relative to its reserves.

title: Substantial Net Official Flows from UN Agencies
description: In 2021, Sudan received $1,781,999.95 in net official flows from UN agencies, reflecting international support and aid.

title: Lowest GDP Growth Rate
description: In 2023, Sudan experienced a significant economic downturn with a GDP growth rate of -20.11%, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Intellectual Property Payments
description: In 2020, Sudan's charges for the use of intellectual property were valued at just $1,642, indicating minimal engagement in global intellectual property exchanges.

title: Lowest Vitamin A Supplementation Coverage
description: As of 2022, only 1% of children aged 6-59 months in Sudan received Vitamin A supplementation, highlighting a critical public health challenge.

title: Lowest Total Reserves Relative to External Debt
description: In 2017, Sudan's total reserves were only 0.81% of its total external debt, indicating a precarious financial position.

title: Minimal International Tourism Expenditures
description: In 2018, international tourism expenditures accounted for just 0.16% of Sudan's total imports, reflecting a limited tourism sector.

title: Lowest GDP Per Capita
description: Sudan's GDP per capita was recorded at 311.38 in constant local currency units in 2023, one of the lowest figures worldwide.

title: Lowest GNI Per Capita
description: In 2023, Sudan's GNI per capita stood at 308.45 in constant local currency units, reflecting low national income levels.

title: Lowest Exports as a Percentage of GDP
description: Exports of goods and services constituted only 1.11% of Sudan's GDP in 2023, indicating limited international trade engagement.

title: Lowest Imports as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2023, imports accounted for 1.37% of Sudan's GDP, suggesting a constrained import sector.

title: Lowest Trade as a Percentage of GDP
description: Sudan's trade represented only 2.47% of its GDP in 2023, highlighting limited economic openness.

title: Lowest Services Value Added to GDP
description: In 2023, services contributed just 7.48% to Sudan's GDP, indicating a small service sector.

title: Lowest Alcohol Consumption Per Capita
description: Sudan had one of the lowest alcohol consumption rates globally in 2020, with an average of 0.01 liters per capita.

title: Lowest Female Labor Force with Advanced Education
description: In 2022, only 24.83% of Sudan's female working-age population had advanced education, reflecting gender disparities in education.
